newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: CBA cuts housing and business rates.
newsitem.headline: CBA cuts housing and business rates.

text.p: Commonwealth Bank of Australia said on Friday it would cut its standard variable mortgage rate to 7.20 percent from 7.55 percent and would lower its prime business rate to 8.95 percent from 9.25 percent.
CBA also said it would cut its no-frills mortgage rate to 6.7 percent from 6.95 percent.
The mortgage reductions are effective from May 26 for new customers and from July 14 for existing customers.
CBA, one of Australia's big four banks, said the reduction in the prime business rate would take effect on July 1.
The other major banks have not yet responded to the 0.5 percentage point monetary policy easing announced earlier on Friday by the Reserve Bank of Australia.
